class.name: FastNoise
class.brief_description: Generates noise using the FastNoise library.
class.description: This class generates noise using the FastNoise library, which is a collection of several noise algorithms including Cellular, Perlin, Value, and more. Most generated noise values are in the range of [code][-1,1][/code], however not always. Some of the cellular noise algorithms return results above [code]1[/code].

method.name: get_cellular_distance2_indices
method.description: Retrieve both indices used for the distance2 cellular noise calculation. See [member cellular_distance2_index0] and [member cellular_distance2_index1].

method.name: get_image
method.argument: Invert the colors. White becomes black. Black becomes white.
method.description: Returns a 2D [Image] generated from the current noise settings. Images are normalized, with black set to the lowest noise value, and white being the highest value.

method.name: get_noise_1d
method.description: Returns the 1D noise value at the given (x) coordinate. Specifically, it returns the 2D noise value with the (y) coordinate fixed at [code]0.0[/code]. Also see [member offset].

method.name: get_noise_2d
method.description: Returns the 2D noise value at the given position. Also see [member offset].

method.name: get_noise_2dv
method.description: Returns the 2D noise value at the given position. Also see [member offset].

method.name: get_noise_3d
method.description: Returns the 3D noise value at the given position. Also see [member offset].

method.name: get_noise_3dv
method.description: Returns the 3D noise value at the given position. Also see [member offset].

method.name: get_seamless_image
method.argument: Invert the colors. White becomes black. Black becomes white.
method.description: Returns the results of the parent [Noise] get_seamless_image(), which calls [method get_image].

method.name: get_white_noise_4d
method.description: Returns the 4D noise value at the given position. [member offset] has no effect on this function. However you can manually offset your own input coordinates to achieve the same result.

method.name: perturb_2dv
method.description: Returns new input coordinates after having been perturbed by the current settings.

method.name: perturb_3dv
method.description: Returns new input coordinates after having been perturbed by the current settings.

method.name: perturb_fractal_2dv
method.description: Returns new input coordinates after having been perturbed by the current settings.

method.name: perturb_fractal_3dv
method.description: Returns new input coordinates after having been perturbed by the current settings.

method.name: set_cellular_distance2_indices
method.description: Retrieve both indices used for the distance2 cellular noise calculation. See [member cellular_distance2_index0] and [member cellular_distance2_index1].

constants.constant: A lattice of points are assigned random values then interpolated based on neighboring values.
Value noise passed through additional fractal algorithms.
A lattice of random gradients. Their dot products are interpolated to obtain values in between the lattices.
Perlin noise passed through additional fractal algorithms.
Cellular includes both Worley noise and Voronoi diagrams which creates various regions of the same value.
Similar to Perlin noise, but slower. Has more variance in peaks and valleys.
Cubic noise passed through additional fractal algorithms.
Use the recursive FastNoise lookup object for input cellular values.
